skill.name: claude-opus-4-5-migration
skill.description: Migrate prompts and code from Claude Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, or Opus 4.1 to Opus 4.5. Use when the user wants to update their codebase, prompts, or API calls to use Opus 4.5. Handles model string updates and prompt adjustments for known Opus 4.5 behavioral differences. Does NOT migrate Haiku 4.5.

security_audit.summary: This official skill contains migration guidance and static prompt snippets. No executable code or external calls are present, so risk is low and suitable for publication.

content.value_statement: Your code or prompts still target older Claude models and risk mismatches. This skill updates model strings and guides optional prompt fixes for Opus 4.5.
actual_capabilities: Replace Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1 model strings with Opus 4.5 equivalents for supported platforms.
Identify and remove the unsupported context-1m-2025-08-07 beta header with a note.
Provide effort parameter configuration and beta flag examples for Opus 4.5 requests.
Apply targeted prompt snippets to address overtriggering, over-engineering, code exploration, frontend design, and thinking sensitivity when requested.
Summarize all migration changes for user review.
limitations: Prompt adjustments are only applied when the user requests them or reports issues.
Effort parameter guidance is shown for Anthropic API examples and may need adaptation for other platforms.
Requires the platform or model strings to be identifiable in the codebase.

use_cases.title: Update API model strings
use_cases.description: Replace legacy Claude model identifiers with Opus 4.5 across API calls.

use_cases.title: Tune system prompts
use_cases.description: Apply specific prompt snippets to fix overtriggering or over-engineering issues.

use_cases.title: Standardize migration
use_cases.description: Align multiple services on Opus 4.5 model strings and document the changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this repo and update any Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, or Opus 4.1 model strings to Opus 4.5 for Anthropic API.

prompt_templates.title: Remove beta header
prompt_templates.prompt: Remove the context-1m-2025-08-07 beta header and add the recommended note. Then update model strings to Opus 4.5.

prompt_templates.title: Add effort config
prompt_templates.prompt: Update model strings to Opus 4.5 and add effort set to high with the required beta flag in our requests.

prompt_templates.title: Targeted prompt fixes
prompt_templates.scenario: Tools overtrigger and code not read
prompt_templates.prompt: Update model strings to Opus 4.5 and apply the tool overtriggering and code exploration snippets to the system prompt.

output_examples.input: Please migrate our Anthropic API calls to Opus 4.5 and summarize the changes.
output: Replaced three legacy model strings with claude-opus-4-5-20251101
Removed the unsupported context-1m-2025-08-07 beta header and added a note
Listed updated files and next step guidance for prompt issues

best_practices: Confirm the platform in use before replacing model strings.
Apply prompt snippets only for reported issues or explicit requests.
Summarize every change so teams can review migrations quickly.
anti_patterns: Applying all prompt snippets without a user complaint.
Leaving unsupported beta headers in place.

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude platforms?
faq.answer: It provides model strings for Anthropic API, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI Foundry.

faq.question: What models can it migrate?
faq.answer: It migrates Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1 to Opus 4.5.

faq.question: How do I integrate effort settings?
faq.answer: Use the effort beta flag and output_config effort value in your request payload.

faq.question: Does it send my data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not transmit files or data.

faq.question: What if tools are triggering too often?
faq.answer: Apply the tool overtriggering snippet to soften aggressive instructions.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual updates?
faq.answer: It standardizes model strings and adds targeted fixes with clear summaries.
